Rhodesia (airport) 罗得西亚索尔兹伯里（机场）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"说，讲"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: say, speak, state, talk, tell, utter
means: say ： 最普通常用词，指用语言表达思想，着重所说的内容。
speak ： 侧重于说话动作的本身，着重说话的能力而不在内容，可以是长篇大论的演讲，也可以是三言两语的交谈，甚至指简单的开口发声说话。
state ： 较正式用词，通常指用明确的语言或文字着重地叙述事实，既强调内容又注重语气。
talk ： 普通用词，侧重指与人交谈时的连续说话，可指单方面较长谈话，和speak一样，着重说活动作而不侧重内容。
tell ： 普通用词，指把某事告诉或讲述给某人听，口语或书面语均可用。
utter ： 着重说话的行为，常指声音的使用，突出用噪子发声。

sentence.Network_en: All this, needless to say, had been culled second-hand from radio reports.
sentence.Network_cn: 不用说，所有这些都是从电台报道中采集来的二手材料。

sentence.Network_en: The deal seems so attractive it would be ridiculous to say no.
sentence.Network_cn: 这笔交易看上去太诱人了，要是拒绝它简直是笑话。

sentence.Network_en: People always think I'm a fool, and I dare say they're right.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们总认为我是个傻瓜，想必他们是对的。

lj.lj_ly: it goes without saying that lay appointees must be selected with care.
lj.lj_ls: 不用说，必须谨慎选择非业内的受托人。

jx.jx_en_mean: contribute a specified amount to a conversation or discussion

lj.lj_ly: a dull girl with little to say for herself.
lj.lj_ls: 几乎找不到话说的迟钝女孩。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Law)how do you find? (addressed to the jury when requesting its verdict)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (律)法官询问陪审团裁决时问］诸位有何高见

phrase.cizu_name: I (或 he, she 等) cannot (或 could not) say

jx.jx_en_mean: I (or he, she, etc.) do not know
I cannot refrain from saying (used to emphasize an opinion)

lj.lj_ly: you have a nerve, I must say!.

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. dated)used to express surprise or to draw attention to a remark
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，旧)［用于表示吃惊或吸引注意力］我说，听着

lj.lj_ly: I say, that's a bit much!.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to indicate that one would like something
used to introduce a stronger alternative or addition to something already said

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to indicate that one understands what someone is trying to imply

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used in spoken English to express disagreement or disbelief

jx.jx_en_mean: give permission or instructions to do something

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English secgan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zeggen and German sagen

encyclopedia.content: 单词信息 单词：say [sei] say的过去式said /sed/，过去分词said /sed/，第三人称says /sez/ 释义 vt. 1. 说； 讲 What you say is true in a sense. 你所说的在某种意义上讲是真实的。 1. 说明； 表明； 宣称； 书面材料或可见的东西提供信息； 指示 Please specify what you really want to say. 请具体说明你的真实想法。 2. 比方说； 假定说，假设，例如 Suppose your father saw you now, what would you say? 假设你父亲现

entry.tran: 说;讲
entry.def: When you say something, you speak words.

example.ex: 'I'm sorry,' he said...
example.tran: “对不起，”他说。

example.ex: She said they were very impressed...
example.tran: 她说他们被深深打动了。

entry.tran: (表达观点或陈述事实，否定用法表示婉转暗示某事并非事实)说，表示
entry.def: You use say in expressions such as I would just like to say to introduce what you are actually saying, or to indicate that you are expressing an opinion or admitting a fact. If you state that you can't say something or you wouldn't say something, you are indicating in a polite or indirect way that it is not the case.

example.ex: I would just like to say that this is the most hypocritical thing I have ever heard in my life...
example.tran: 我只想说这是我这辈子听说过的最虚伪的事情。

example.ex: I have to say I didn't even know Fox Lane Police Station existed till about four or five years ago...
example.tran: 我必须承认直到四五年前我才知道有福克斯巷警察局 。

entry.tran: 告知;宣称;表明
entry.def: You can mention the contents of a piece of writing by mentioning what it says or what someone says in it.

example.ex: The report says there is widespread and routine torture of political prisoners in the country...
example.tran: 这份报告称该国一直普遍存在折磨政治犯的现象。

example.ex: Auntie Winnie wrote back saying Mam wasn't well enough to write...
example.tran: 温妮姨妈回信说妈妈身体尚未康复，无法写信。

entry.tran: (自己)想，琢磨;自忖
entry.def: If you say something to yourself, you think it.

example.ex: Perhaps I'm still dreaming, I said to myself...
example.tran: 也许我还在做梦，我心里想。

example.ex: 'Keep your temper,' he said to himself.
example.tran: “别生气，”他暗暗告诉自己。

entry.tran: 发言权;决定权
entry.def: If you have a say in something, you have the right to give your opinion and influence decisions relating to it.

example.ex: You can get married at sixteen, and yet you haven't got a say in the running of the country...
example.tran: 你 16 岁时可以结婚，但还无权参与国家政事。

example.ex: The students wanted more say in the government of the university.
example.tran: 学生们想更多地参与大学的管理。

entry.tran: (钟、刻度盘、地图等)表明，指向，显示
entry.def: You indicate the information given by something such as a clock, dial, or map by mentioning what it says .

example.ex: The clock said four minutes past eleven...
example.tran: 钟显示时间是 11 点 4 分。

example.ex: The map says there's six of them.
example.tran: 地图上显示共有六处。

entry.tran: 说明;表明;表示
entry.def: If something says something about a person, situation, or thing, it gives important information about them.

example.ex: I think that says a lot about how well Seles is playing...
example.tran: 我认为那很能说明塞勒斯表现得有多出色。

example.ex: The appearance of the place and the building says something about the importance of the project.
example.tran: 从周边环境和这幢大楼的外观可以看出这个项目的举足轻重。

entry.tran: 说明，表示(…有很多优点)
entry.def: If something says a lot for a person or thing, it shows that this person or thing is very good or has a lot of good qualities.

example.ex: It says a lot for him that he has raised his game to the level required...
example.tran: 他将比赛技能提至所要求的水平，这说明他颇有能耐。

example.ex: It says much for Brookner's skill that the book is sad, but never depressing.
example.tran: 这本书笔调忧伤，却并不令人沮丧，这很能说明布鲁克纳超群的写作技巧。

entry.tran: (通常表示说话者认为某人优点不多)我会这样形容他们/你可以这样形容他们
entry.def: You use say in expressions such as I'll say that for them and you can say this for them after or before you mention a good quality that someone has, usually when you think they do not have many good qualities.

example.ex: He's usually smartly-dressed, I'll say that for him...
example.tran: 我能说的是，至少他通常穿着入时。

example.ex: At the very least, he is devastatingly sure of himself, you can say that.
example.tran: 至少还可以说，他对自己是深信不疑的。

entry.tran: 假定;假设
entry.def: You can use say when you want to discuss something that might possibly happen or be true.

example.ex: Say you could change anything about the world we live in, what would it be?
example.tran: 假定你能对我们所生活的这个世界作出任意改变，你会改变什么呢？

entry.tran: 比如说;比方说
entry.def: You can use say or let's say when you mention something as an example.

example.ex: To see the problem here more clearly, let's look at a different biological system, say, an acorn...
example.tran: 为更清晰地理解此处的问题，我们来看一种不同的生物系统，比如说，橡子。

example.ex: Someone with, say, between 300 and 500 acres could be losing thousands of pounds a year.
example.tran: 比方说，拥有 300 到 500 英亩地的人，可能每年会损失几千英镑。

entry.tran: (用以唤起注意或表示惊讶、高兴、崇敬)嘿，喂，哎呀，啊
entry.def: Say is used to attract someone's attention or to express surprise, pleasure, or admiration.

example.ex: Say, Leo, how would you like to have dinner one night, just you and me?
example.tran: 哎，利奥，找个晚上一起吃顿饭如何，就你和我？

entry.tran: 清楚说明事实;明确表达(…的)感觉
entry.def: If you say that something says it all, you mean that it shows you very clearly the truth about a situation or someone's feelings.

example.ex: This is my third visit in a week, which says it all.
example.tran: 这是我一周内第3次拜访，这说明了一切。

entry.tran: (表示吃惊)不会吧;(亦常表示事实上并不吃惊)我一点也不觉得奇怪，用不着你说也知道
entry.def: You can use 'You don't say' to express surprise at what someone has told you. People often use this expression to indicate that in fact they are not surprised.

example.ex: 'I'm a writer.' — 'You don't say. What kind of book are you writing?'
example.tran: “我是作家。”——“不会吧。你写哪方面的书？”

entry.tran: 值得称道之处;优点
entry.def: If you say there is a lot to be said for something, you mean you think it has a lot of good qualities or aspects.

example.ex: There's a lot to be said for being based in the country.
example.tran: 把总部设在该国有很多优势。

entry.tran: 寡言少语;不爱说话
entry.def: If you say that someone doesn't have much to say for himself or herself, you mean that they are not speaking very much during a conversation.

example.ex: He's never got much to say for himself.
example.tran: 他向来寡言少语。

entry.tran: 你有什么好说的;你有什么要辩解的
entry.def: If someone asks what you have to say for yourself, they are asking what excuse you have for what you have done.

example.ex: 'Well,' she said eventually, 'what have you to say for yourself?'
example.tran: “那么”，她最后说，“你有什么好说的？”

entry.tran: 显而易见;不言而喻;不用说
entry.def: If something goes without saying, it is obvious.

example.ex: It goes without saying that if someone has lung problems they should not smoke.
example.tran: 不用说，有肺病的人不应吸烟。

entry.tran: 发表意见;阐述观点
entry.def: When one of the people or groups involved in a discussion has their say, they give their opinion.

example.ex: The Football Association have had their say.
example.tran: 足协已经发表了意见。

entry.tran: (用于对很多人不喜欢的人或事物表示赞赏时)随你怎么说,不管你怎么认为
entry.def: You use 'Say what you like about someone or something' when you are about to mention one good thing about a person or thing that many people do not like.

example.ex: Say what you like about them, but they did love their Mum.
example.tran: 随你怎么说，但他们确实爱自己的妈妈。

entry.tran: (尤指乐于接受他人刚刚提出要给予自己的东西)我不反对，我没意见，好哇
entry.def: You use 'I wouldn't say no' to indicate that you would like something, especially something that has just been offered to you.

example.ex: I wouldn't say no to a drink.
example.tran: 我倒想喝一杯。

entry.tran: (引出语气更重或更极端的描述)即使不说是…,虽不能说…
entry.def: You can use not to say when adding a stronger or more extreme description than the one you have just used.

example.ex: To those who've never received million dollar royalty cheques, this sounded a little odd, not to say offensive.
example.tran: 对于那些从没有收到过上百万美元版权费的人来说，这听起来就算不令人反感，至少也让人觉得有点儿怪。

entry.tran: 更不用说;何况
entry.def: You use to say nothing of when you mention an additional thing which gives even more strength to the point you are making.

example.ex: Unemployment leads to a sense of uselessness, to say nothing of financial problems.
example.tran: 失业会让人觉得自己一无是处，更何况还会带来经济问题。

entry.tran: (用于提醒别人所说话可能会具有冒犯性或令人震惊)可以说
entry.def: You use shall I say and shall we say in order to warn someone that what you are about to say may cause offence or be surprising.

example.ex: ...whereas when you get older you're rather set in your ways, shall I say...
example.tran: 然而随着年纪渐长，可以说，你的大局已定了。

example.ex: My involvement has not been altogether, shall we say, ethical.
example.tran: 可以说，我的参与还不是完全合乎道德。

entry.tran: 亦即;也就是说;换句话说
entry.def: You use that is to say or that's to say to indicate that you are about to express the same idea more clearly or precisely.

example.ex: ...territories that were occupied in 1967, that is to say, in the West Bank and Gaza.
example.tran: 1967年被占的领土，也就是约旦河西岸和加沙地带的被占领土

entry.tran: 让你说对了;一点没错;我同意;说得太对了
entry.def: You can use 'You can say that again' to express strong agreement with what someone has just said.

example.ex: 'Must have been a fiddly job.' — 'You can say that again.'
example.tran: “那一定是件精细活。”——“说得太对了。”

sentences.sentence: "let him have his say"
"He said that he wanted to marry her"
"tell me what is bothering you"
"state your opinion"
"state your name"
"He alleged that he was the victim of a crime"
"He said it was too late to intervene in the war"
"The registrar says that I owe the school money"
"Let us say that he did not tell the truth"
"Let's say you had a lot of money--what would you do?"

means.word_mean: 4. have or contain a certain wording or form;

sentences.sentence: "The passage reads as follows"
"What does the law say?"

means.word_mean: 5. state as one's opinion or judgement; declare;

sentences.sentence: "I say let's forget this whole business"
"She said `Hello' to everyone in the office"

means.word_mean: 7. give instructions to or direct somebody to do something with authority;

sentences.sentence: "I said to him to go home"
"She ordered him to do the shopping"
"The mother told the child to get dressed"

means.word_mean: 8. speak, pronounce, or utter in a certain way;

sentences.sentence: "She pronounces French words in a funny way"
"I cannot say `zip wire'"
"Can the child sound out this complicated word?"

means.word_mean: 9. recite or repeat a fixed text;

sentences.sentence: "Say grace"
"She said her `Hail Mary'"
"What does this painting say?"
"Did his face say anything about how he felt?"
"The clock says noon"

auth_sentence.content: Experts say women with the condition need more support.
auth_sentence.res_content: Experts say women with the condition need more support.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Experts say women with the condition need more support.

auth_sentence.content: Experts say more research is needed to explore this.
auth_sentence.res_content: Experts say more research is needed to explore this.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Experts say more research is needed to explore this.

auth_sentence.content: Chelsea at Stamford Bridge - what can you say?
auth_sentence.res_content: Chelsea at Stamford Bridge - what can you say?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Chelsea at Stamford Bridge - what can you say?

sentences.en: He glared angrily at her but did not say a word.
sentences.cn: 他怒视着她, 却一言不发。

sentences.en: He said that he had never been to Tokyo.
sentences.cn: 他说他从来没去过东京。

means.word_mean: 说明; 表明; 宣称; 书面材料或可见的东西提供信息; 指示

sentences.en: I will say how to use it.
It is said that there has been a big flood.
sentences.cn: 据说, 那里遭受了一场大洪水的袭击。

sentences.en: It's hard to say what is wrong.
I say her plan is the better one.
sentences.cn: 我认为她的计划是个好主意。

sentences.en: I'd say he'll come at 9 o'clock.
sentences.cn: 我估计他将在九点钟回来。

sentences.en: He wasn't allowed much say in choosing his holiday.
sentences.cn: 在选择假期的问题上不让他有很多发言权。

sentences.en: I'll not want to say in front of the reporters.
sentences.cn: 我不愿在记者面前谈论我的观点。
什么书都行，比如说杂志
